comment.author: 30937372@N00
comment._content: This statue is not in Zambia, it's on the Zimbabwe side of Mosi Oa Tunya (Victoria Falls)

comment.author: 59350149@N07
comment._content: AJ Scotts comment is correct, the statue is close to the Devils Cataract on the Zimbabwe side.

comment.author: 7646898@N05
comment._content: As far as I have been told the statue no longer stands there. It has been removed by the current government. Does anyone know if that is true?

comment.author: 59459690@N06
comment._content: The statue is still there. The wovvets tried to rock it off the pedestal a couple of years ago but they were too drunk and disorganized to achieve their objective which was, apparently, to throw it into the river.

comment.author: 59352877@N05
comment._content: Glamorous slim young lady might be the then elegant Ella Barker. Can’t say who she's photo’d speaking to. The statue is in Zimbabwe and still standing as is so much else - contrary to impressions given by the international press. Do take a holiday there - its still a beautiful country full of amazingly smiling, helpful, friendly people. Try www.imiresafariranch.com/

comment.author: 52335372@N08
comment._content: Great picture, brings back many memories of Rhodesia.
